alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 1:54PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Laramie County through 230 PM MDT... At 153 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Warren AFB, or 7 miles west of Cheyenne, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, South Greeley, Ranchettes, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 4 and 36. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 343 and 366. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
